result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Jamison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:05 Defendant Marcus D Jamison in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Marcus D Jamison in custody.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed and read-in to 16CM52.

9:20 Defendant Marcus D Jamison in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Marcus D Jamison in custody.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Zell states that he has filed motion for other acts evidence. There were similar charges in Dane County with same victims. He asks that this information be allowed to be presented to the jury as it shows a pattern of behavior. Attorney Weiland objects to allowing Dane County cases to be allowed as evidence. He also presents his motion to bring in evidence of Wood County case in which defendant was found not guilty by jury of alleged crimes with same victim.
Court grants State's motion for other acts evidence as far as incidents happening in Dane County, but will not allow specifics.
Court denies Defendant's motion to allow jury to hear that defendant was found not guilty of a previous Wood County case.
Attacking Credibility of Witness PUrsuant to 906.07 and 906.08 Wis Stats
from defendant
Motion hearing on January 6, 2017 at 09:00 am.
for Admission of Other Acts Evidence

2:01 Defendant Marcus D Jamison in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Marcus D Jamison in custody.  Michael Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Weiland filed a motion to withdraw on 16CM52 and 16CM53. He does not represent him on 16CM325.  
Court questions defendant. He has no objection to Court hearing matter in the absence of Judge Wolf. He wants Attorney Weiland to continue to represent him. Attorney Weiland states he is willing to continue to represent him. 
Court denies motion to withdraw.  Bond is continued.
to Withdraw

1:39 Defendant Marcus D Jamison in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Marcus D Jamison in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Judge Potter has set a $5,000 cash bond. Court will continue bond. Matter will be set for trial.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Refused to Sign

Defendant Marcus D Jamison in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Marcus D Jamison in custody.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court address the defendant missing his jury trial after being notified the morning of the trial.  Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant must appear before Judge Wolf.

8:56 Attorney William George Weiland in court.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Weiland states that defendant has told him that he is not coming to court today.
Court orders warrant. No bond. Must been seen by Judge Wolf.
Jury is brought into courtroom and dismissed for the day. Court will impose jury fees on defendant.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.

10:33 Defendant Marcus D Jamison in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Michael Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant asks that bond be modified so he can have contact with victim for visitation purposes.
Court states that he needs to file a notice in writing so District Attorney can notify victim and get input. Court states that normally visitation arrangements can be made through the Family Center.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus D Jamison
Current: 258 15th Ave S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2016)
Prior: 1600 Briggs Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Notice for 9/15/16 jury trial handed directly to defendant.  Defendant gives new address of 258 15th Ave S, WRW
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

9:37 Defendant Marcus D Jamison in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Zell states that victim is not here today. He spoke with her yesterday and told her to be here today. He also has a proof of service. He has tried to call her, but has not gotten an answer. He asks for warrant and jury trial be cancelled today. Attorney Weiland is objecting and wishes to proceed with trial today.
Court orders witness warrant. $1,000 cash bond set. Court will not proceed with jury trial today. Subpoena is marked as exhibit #1. Bond is continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on July 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Zell has filed a motion for joinder of cases 16CM52, 16CM53 & at CM325.
Attorney Weiland states the defendant does not object. 
Court grants motion for joinder.
